pullRequest.title: Move static fields and methods from MethodHandle to MethodHandleHelper
pullRequest.bodyText:
1. Move code from MethodHandle to MethodHandleHelper
The following static final fields are moved from MethodHandle to
MethodHandleHelper:

UNSAFE
JITHELPERS
BSM_ARGUMENT_SIZE
BSM_ARGUMENT_COUNT_OFFSET
BSM_ARGUMENTS_OFFSET
BSM_LOOKUP_ARGUMENT_INDEX
BSM_NAME_ARGUMENT_INDEX
BSM_TYPE_ARGUMENT_INDEX
BSM_OPTIONAL_ARGUMENTS_START_INDEX

The following native static methods are moved from MethodHandle to
MethodHandleHelper:

getCPTypeAt
getCPMethodTypeAt
getCPMethodHandleAt
getCPClassNameAt
getCPConstantDynamicAt

The following Java static methods are moved from MethodHandle to
MethodHandleHelper:

resolveConstantDynamic
constructorPlaceHolder
invokeBsm
resolveInvokeDynamic
sendResolveMethodHandle
resolveFieldHandleHelper
getClassFromJ9Class
fromFieldDescriptorString
getAdditionalBsmArg
throwNoClassDefFoundError
getJ9ClassFromClass

This is done to support the OpenJDK MethodHandle class. Some of the
above Java static methods will be updated to support the OpenJDK
MethodHandle class.
This will also resolve a limitation of vmconstantpool.xml, which exposes
some of the above Java static methods in the native code. The OpenJDK
MethodHandle class does not have the above Java static methods. Having
the static methods in MethodHandleHelper allows them to be exposed to
both OpenJ9 and OpenJDK implementations. This prevents the JCL
initialization crash, associated to vmconstantpool.xml, when the OpenJDK
MethodHandle class is enabled.
2. Update Java dependencies to use MethodHandleHelper static fields/methods
Previously, the MethodHandle class contained UNSAFE, JITHELPERS and
getJ9ClassFromClass. Since these items have been moved from the
MethodHandle to MethodHandleHelper class, the associated Java
dependencies have been updated to use UNSAFE, JITHELPERS and
getJ9ClassFromClass from the MethodHandleHelper class.
3. Update native dependencies to use MethodHandleHelper
The names of the following Java native methods are updated in native
code since they are moved from the MethodHandle to MethodHandleHelper
class:

getCPTypeAt
getCPMethodTypeAt
getCPMethodHandleAt
getCPClassNameAt
getCPConstantDynamicAt

The names of the following Java methods, which are invoked from native
code, are updated since they are moved from the MethodHandle to
MethodHandleHelper class:

sendResolveMethodHandle
resolveInvokeDynamic
resolveConstantDynamic
constructorPlaceHolder

The above MethodHandleHelper Java methods will be used in both OpenJ9
and OpenJDK JSR292 implementations.
Related: #7352
Co-authored-by: Jack Lu Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com
Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh sbabneet@ca.ibm.com

nodes.bodyText: Why is constructorPlaceHolder needed for OJDK methodhandles?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -411,13 +407,15 @@ SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0 OR Apache-2.0 OR GPL-2.0 WITH Classpath-excepti
 	<staticmethodref class="java/lang/J9VMInternals" name="initializationAlreadyFailed" signature="(Ljava/lang/Class;)V"/>
 	<staticmethodref class="java/lang/J9VMInternals" name="recordInitializationFailure" signature="(Ljava/lang/Class;Ljava/lang/Throwable;)V"/>
 
+	<!-- Static method references needed to support OpenJ9 and OpenJDK MethodHandles. -->
+	<staticmethodref class="java/lang/invoke/MethodHandleHelper" name="sendResolveMethodHandle" signature="(ILjava/lang/Class;Ljava/lang/Class;Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/ClassLoader;)Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodHandle;" flags="opt_methodHandleCommon"/>
+	<staticmethodref class="java/lang/invoke/MethodHandleHelper" name="resolveInvokeDynamic" signature="(JLjava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;J)Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodHandle;" flags="opt_methodHandleCommon"/>
+	<staticmethodref class="java/lang/invoke/MethodHandleHelper" name="resolveConstantDynamic" signature="(JLjava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;J)Ljava/lang/Object;" versions="11-" flag="opt_methodHandleCommon"/>
+	<staticmethodref class="java/lang/invoke/MethodHandleHelper" name="constructorPlaceHolder" signature="(Ljava/lang/Object;)Ljava/lang/Object;" flags="opt_methodHandleCommon"/>

nodes.bodyText: There are a lot of xxxxPlaceHolder methods.  Why is only this one being moved?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1521,19 +1052,6 @@ private MethodHandle filterArgumentsPlaceHolder(int index, int parentOffset, int
 		return this;
 	}
 	
-	/*[IF ]*/
-	/*
-	 * Used to preserve the new objectRef on the stack when avoiding the call-in for
-	 * constructorHandles.  Must return 'this' so stackmapper will keep the object
-	 * alive.
-	 */
-	/*[ENDIF]*/
-	@SuppressWarnings("unused")
-	@VMCONSTANTPOOL_METHOD
-	private static Object constructorPlaceHolder(Object newObjectRef) {

@@ -0,0 +1,528 @@
+/*[INCLUDE-IF Sidecar18-SE]*/
+/*******************************************************************************

+ * the terms of the Eclipse Public License 2.0 which accompanies this
+ * distribution and is available at https://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-2.0/
+ * or the Apache License, Version 2.0 which accompanies this distribution and
+ * is available at https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.
+ *
+ * This Source Code may also be made available under the following
+ * Secondary Licenses when the conditions for such availability set
+ * forth in the Eclipse Public License, v. 2.0 are satisfied: GNU
+ * General Public License, version 2 with the GNU Classpath
+ * Exception [1] and GNU General Public License, version 2 with the
+ * OpenJDK Assembly Exception [2].
+ *
+ * [1] https://www.gnu.org/software/classpath/license.html
+ * [2] http://openjdk.java.net/legal/assembly-exception.html
+ *
+ * SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0 OR Apache-2.0 OR GPL-2.0 WITH Classpath-exception-2.0 OR LicenseRef-GPL-2.0 WITH Assembly-exception
+ *******************************************************************************/
+package java.lang.invoke;
+
+import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles.Lookup;
+import java.util.ArrayList;
+import java.util.Objects;
+
+import com.ibm.oti.util.Msg;
+import com.ibm.oti.vm.VM;
+import com.ibm.oti.vm.VMLangAccess;
+
+/*[IF Sidecar19-SE]
+import jdk.internal.misc.Unsafe;
+import jdk.internal.reflect.ConstantPool;
+/*[ELSE]*/
+import sun.misc.Unsafe;
+import sun.reflect.ConstantPool;
+/*[ENDIF]*/
+
+import com.ibm.jit.JITHelpers;
+
+/**
+ * Static methods for the MethodHandle class.
+ */
+public final class MethodHandleHelper {

commit.message:
Move static fields and methods from MethodHandle to MethodHandleHelper

The code has been verbatim moved from MethodHandle to
MethodHandleHelper.

The following static final fields are moved from MethodHandle to
MethodHandleHelper:
- UNSAFE
- JITHELPERS
- BSM_ARGUMENT_SIZE
- BSM_ARGUMENT_COUNT_OFFSET
- BSM_ARGUMENTS_OFFSET
- BSM_LOOKUP_ARGUMENT_INDEX
- BSM_NAME_ARGUMENT_INDEX
- BSM_TYPE_ARGUMENT_INDEX
- BSM_OPTIONAL_ARGUMENTS_START_INDEX

The following native static methods are moved from MethodHandle to
MethodHandleHelper:
- getCPTypeAt
- getCPMethodTypeAt
- getCPMethodHandleAt
- getCPClassNameAt
- getCPConstantDynamicAt

The following Java static methods are moved from MethodHandle to
MethodHandleHelper:
- resolveConstantDynamic
- constructorPlaceHolder
- invokeBsm
- resolveInvokeDynamic
- sendResolveMethodHandle
- resolveFieldHandleHelper
- getClassFromJ9Class
- fromFieldDescriptorString
- getAdditionalBsmArg
- throwNoClassDefFoundError
- getJ9ClassFromClass

This is done to support the OpenJDK MethodHandle class. Some of the
above Java static methods will be updated to support the OpenJDK
MethodHandle class.

This will also resolve a limitation of vmconstantpool.xml, which exposes
some of the above Java static methods in the native code. The OpenJDK
MethodHandle class does not have the above Java static methods. Having
the static methods in MethodHandleHelper allows them to be exposed to
both OpenJ9 and OpenJDK implementations. This prevents the JCL
initialization crash, associated to vmconstantpool.xml, when the OpenJDK
MethodHandle class is enabled.

Related: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/7352

Co-authored-by: Jack Lu <Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>

Update Java dependencies to use MethodHandleHelper static fields/methods

Previously, the MethodHandle class contained UNSAFE, JITHELPERS and
getJ9ClassFromClass. Since these items have been moved from the
MethodHandle to MethodHandleHelper class, the associated Java
dependencies have been updated to use UNSAFE, JITHELPERS and
getJ9ClassFromClass from the MethodHandleHelper class.

Related: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/7352

Co-authored-by: Jack Lu <Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>

Update native dependencies to use MethodHandleHelper

The names of the following Java native methods are updated in native
code since they are moved from the MethodHandle to MethodHandleHelper
class:
- getCPTypeAt
- getCPMethodTypeAt
- getCPMethodHandleAt
- getCPClassNameAt
- getCPConstantDynamicAt

The names of the following Java methods, which are invoked from native
code, are updated since they are moved from the MethodHandle to
MethodHandleHelper class:
- sendResolveMethodHandle
- resolveInvokeDynamic
- resolveConstantDynamic
- constructorPlaceHolder

The above MethodHandleHelper Java methods will be used in both OpenJ9
and OpenJDK JSR292 implementations.

Related: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/7352

Co-authored-by: Jack Lu <Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>
